author: {'steamid': '76561198041628378', 'num_games_owned': 1502, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1001, 'last_played': 1586667819}
review:
Dream Car Racing 3D is a very interesting game. I enjoy it for what it is, but it certainly has its own audience. The building aspect of the game is very easy to learn, but building the right thing is tough. There are tutorials but they are somewhat scant, your best bet is to look at some high-rated community made vehicles and study them. See how they made their suspension and steering work. This will you climb the learning curve alot faster, and once you mount the summit, the game is much more satisfying. 

All in all, I personly love the game, it is wide open in terms of what you can do. From rock-crawling trucks to supercars and tanks, there really is no limit here. If you like building, and have a persistant mind, this is where you should go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167069402', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1505696457}
review:
Having been contacted again about this mess and spending another day trying to explain the issues-

This game is worth watching an ad to play.

As for the creation process they added the coloration system I recommended in the comments below to help alleviateate bad connections and tha'ts nice, but the new UI is rather unintuitive, more cluttered and ununiform then before, and with sevral genrations of art all visable from the same place showing clearly what work is being done I ask to what end?


I've been assured all my complaints are understood in the same breath as being told I only have personal resons for my negative review, I think having a single dev doing all the work is silly, that's personal opinion, Having a car design game with only one very repetitive, unrelistic engine sound that 4/5 people think is a fart efect before knowing whats going on! I think is a ligit issue.

My biggest issue right now is a tie between the deformations that come with soft body physics being excessive to the point of looking like youtuber bait and the idea that I should have to say something nice as well if I'm going to point that out.

The contributing modder who contacted me most recently seems to think I should delete this review beacuse of what the game could become but I know it could just get worse. I was on Star Wars Galaxies for NGE and had friends who killed themselves after the combat update. You can't sell me a promise, I don't pay for words, I see what patron has become! between sarkeesian's and s-purple's that shit don't jive.

I've been reported for harassment then harassed, I've seen some of the least self aware people in the industry try to explain themseves and get pissy with me, even so far as recomending my account be deleted.

I'm told the work is tireless, its not hard to set up a stream to just show that your working, I mentoned S-purple? I think the amount of work going into this project is embarising. otherwise there would be better transparency. I'm all for making a living on your pet project but as a reviwer I set out to tell you what its worth and honestly as it stands, not a lot. If you wan't to play this game learn to make games and you will have a more rewarding if not easier time.

Matter of fact, regardless of how much work you put in to makeing a car in this game it can be expected to funtion normaly for less then a minute without having it reset you on the track without deformations. The mutations your creation get trying to acclerate, turn or bank are more like a nightmare then a dream and realy put a dampner on the whole race thing. 



"Developer response:
RoKo0  [developer] Posted: Jul 25 @ 7:09pm
Just read his answers. 
He has leaved his negative review because of: 
"SFX", "wrap your stages or use spheres, invisable walls are brutal", etc"

You know what RK0, you do need to work on SFX and the invisable walls are brutal so I do recomend you use spheres or have your limited stages wrap. Also yeah please read some of the comment section...

author: {'steamid': '76561198105348119', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1499779740}

author: {'steamid': '76561198195095702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1500656598}
review:
This game offers so much in the genre of car building. First off, This may be Early Access game, But what's neat is the developer is very active and open to feedback, so it gets updates and isn't dead. I do say it offers great realstic soft body movement of joints and frame, though the steering is still arcade-like as of now.

My Main focus with my time spent thus far has been very entertaining, the camera system may take some time getting used to but works well. I would like to finalize by saying this game suits anyone who enjoys sandbox style building/soft-body games and/or just wants to test there skills or learn something new about a design and such.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006423698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 21445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7518, 'last_played': 1710029048}

author: {'steamid': '76561198064334191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1497722433}
review:
If you know about cars and the functionality of each individual part, then this is for  you. If you just want to build something silly to drive around in, then you've come to the wrong place: pick up besiege instead. 

But seriously, it's a good game, it just isn't for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023767851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 30348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 21, 'playtime_at_review': 4647, 'last_played': 1711928362}
review: This game is the best sandbox, I love the way it's so easy and fast to create any kind of vehicle in any size and then test it to enhance it as much as possible. I hope to keep some more updates to make it more challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166413706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 9696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 33, 'playtime_at_review': 3016, 'last_played': 1712389252}
review:
[h1]In A Nut Shell[/h1]
An amazing sandbox game that allows you to create Cars, Jets & maps with its ingame easy to use yet powerful tools.
The players have built things beyound cars and jets using the current tools in the game as of this review . 
Race Against high score ghosts that are set based on the best "Time Trial" score.
Share your builds or download others using workshop -or- using the games own website that is connected directly to the game's build mode.

[b]Did I mention that there is damage physics in this game !!? Yes crash away like burnout all you want and if that wasnt enough you can slow down time burn out style and watch it all happen.[/b] 



[h1] Tool system [/h1]
Im still pretty new to the game but as seen below the tool system is one of the most powerful ingame tools i have seen so far and easy to use with its point to point frame dots + physics system and precise collisioning so you can toss away the games that build such things with blocks. If your the type that loves to build and want to base your builds off of some really neat & close to worldly object phsyics.

[url=https://steamuserimages-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/856096260990396084/43D1BDF9D99F31C0635EA68A3417B92444EEF54B/] Screenshot 1	[/url]

[url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=951648911] Screenshot 2	[/url]





[h1]My Exp[/h1]
When I first started this game i was alittle unsure but after playing it , I spend hours building tons of personal cars as well as upgrading its parts with new ideas. As you can see i have less then 100 hours.

You can get some ideas or tips on how to build using real life car frames ( yes this game is that good ). although still a work in progress it has much to offer as long as you can thinking of what to build next.

The Dev seems very caring and on his toes to apply more updates and improvments. Just like any other work in progress you can expect bugs anf glitchs but from what i seen so far the only glitch i seen is when building complex machines the physics sometimes glicths for that part you made with such complexity.



[h1]The Commuinty[/h1]
Seems very settled so far , like all builder sandbox games you have the half that loves to download from workshop and the half that loves to build. 

[h1]Ideas[/h1]
The interaction ingame is alittle limited with interacting with other players but im sure the Dev will keep an eye out for ideas to improve this. I can't image how awesome this game will be with weapons that you can create and pvp. Perhaps a weapon creator mode & import weapons to a map. Driving over a weapon to get it. Allowing for some twisted metal combat. would be nice to have the bullets more focuses on impact driven creating dents and bending parts. Oh there i go again, im talking too much so much to explain but i do not have the time.

All in all this game is a 9/10 ( needs alittle more player interaction, perhaps an offical server with a nice map with racing and PvP. As a round ends the game mode changes as well )

review: i belive this game is a great look at building aspectes in real life, and is very fun to mees around in as well as make amazing and creative builds, i belive this game has alot of potential and will succsed further on, this game is a great game to play for open world sandbox and it is defenatly worth a go!

author: {'steamid': '76561198070432750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1802, 'last_played': 1541252306}
review:
If you are into creating viechles of any kind this game is perfect for you. If you like to test out other peoples creations in maps that other people created, then you will also like this game.

Creation possibillites are endless. Fysics are well put together, and are challenging in a good way. The price is good for what you get. And i like the fact that game also has steam trade cards!

Seriously consider buying the game, if you like viechles and or engineering.

author: {'steamid': '76561198380626010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 114358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12632, 'last_played': 1697246651}
review: This is an awesome game for anyone who is creative and wants to design their own vehicles. I love to experiment with different types of suspensions and try to make my cars perform as well as possible, and I like to try to invent my own suspensions and ways of making a vehicle move. I bought the game when it was on sale (25% off) but I would pay the full $15 for it if I had known exactly how great this game was. It is now my favorite computer game by far!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980217311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1497508875}
review: This game needs a modern wheel hub/knuckle joint. A part of the wheel assembly that everything attaches to instead of what you have right now in the game.....and a steering column r&p or something. Also reintroducing any kind of a visible drive line would be nice, even if its just chain or belt. Can you also change the Angle lock to 'Welding' or something. When I weld a box frame for a car or roll cage that usually does the trick, I don't have to angle lock anything. How could two pieces of metal tubing attach to each other without welding...nevermind...

author: {'steamid': '76561198114255090', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 724, 'last_played': 1640191365}
review:
The game is awesome for someone like me. I love cars and how they work, and I love to sketch out concepts on paper. Using my design skills and knowledge of cars helped me to create my first 3 designs in a few hours.

...and if you have ADHD like me, you will probably find yourself attaching jets to the sides of your design 5 minutes after building it.

10/10 would make cars fly again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198180697153', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 788, 'last_played': 1518981436}
review: This is a great game. It's worth the money. The devolper is really friendly and asked my opinon. So here it is. The game has steam workshop so if you're not the best designer you can just simply install a car or plane or whatever someone has come up with, and then you can drive/fly it. The game says it has multiplayer I don't know if there is but I don't see anything but the devoloper will probably add it. The only con about this game is that when you use frames or supports it seems a bit unrealistic because you have to add a lot of them on the inside. But i guess that's just a challenge. Overall I would definetly recommend this to someone. And there a couple of youtubers that have videos on this game. There is tutorials so if you can't figure out how to build something just use the tutorials.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104625609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 23607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3353, 'last_played': 1691232103}
review:
This game is simply great. 

One thing that I love about this game is that it doesn't restrict you to use some kind of pre-made blocks. Therefore you can build anything from simple cars to space-plane-tank-cranes. You can even make realistic helicopters in this game (check my creations to see proof(not self promotion just for proof)).

If your reaction to this game is:"EWW IT LOKS UGLY AND ITS NOT LIK THE GTA6 TRAILERS AND U HAVE BUILD STUF TO MOVE.", try to go outside, I bet you can't. I once heard from a 30 year old virgin that real life looks great.

+This game is WIP so, hopefully, more things will be added.

So if you you are even a little bit creative you should get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298947688', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2088, 'last_played': 1597431031}
review: I think that Dream Car Racing 3D has a lot of potential and that it's just an incredible game that has very good FPS rates.  I love the Soft Body Physics.  I have never played a game with Soft Body Physics, so it‚Äôs cool to be able to experience that!  The aerodynamics update was awesome!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035781965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 33525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4680, 'last_played': 1643935550}
review: I really enjoy this game. Its got great vehicle building that allows me make any vehicle I can think of. The building is very easy once I learned all of the tricks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015089048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1965, 'last_played': 1573677329}
review: Absolutely amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151037201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 20203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5534, 'last_played': 1689338509}
review:
1) very detailed soft-body physics simulation.
- player can build crumple zones and safety cells
- reinforce or lighten specific chassis areas to suit your design
- crash test in slow-mo, observe the deformations as it happens
- body flex has observable effect on vehicle ride and handling
- spring rate and damping changes, suspension geometry adjustments have impact to vehicle

2) aerodynamics simulation
- effect of Center Of Lift on Center of Mass is observable
- adjustable lift and drag coefficients
- transonic flight effects (harder to break the sonic barrier as you approach it)

Suggestions:
- add adjustable hinge properties to point settings (one way, two way, rotate only, pivot etc), will make it simpler to define movements on a point
- add driveshaft frames for power transfer (+transmissions)
- add steering frames for control transfer

author: {'steamid': '76561198093877340', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 3454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2892, 'last_played': 1497458209}
review: Limitless creative game. You can build very cool realistically detailed vehicles. 4 wheels or 40 wheels, big or small, flying or crawling, + very cool maps that you can test your builds on them(You can create your own map too). This game is awesome don't miss it ! 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198208528204', 'num_games_owned': 39, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2532, 'last_played': 1513558561}
review: I am very impressed with what one developer can do. This is a well made game, that is open to creativity. If you know what you're doing, you can make a good vehicle. Not many glitches, but also not many features. Still, the game is new, so features such as live multiplayer should come in the future. At the time that I got the game (February 2017), there were no bad reviews. The two bad reveiws as of April 27, 2017 are stupid. One of them states how they basically could not make a car (because they are unwilling to learn), which there is evidence that you can make cars in this game. And the other is that it does not have live multiplayer, which I understand, but you should not rate a game negatively because it doesn't have a feature that it was not expected to have. For what it is supposed to be, the game is perfect. Good job, RoKo0.

review: Great game with a lot of potential!

author: {'steamid': '76561198073630725', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 10987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1680422331}
review:
This game is what I would desribe as "This reminds me of auto cad". At first it seems very confusing but when you get into it and learn the controls it gets very addicting and time consuming.

Pros: 
Good Physics
Practically any computer can run this.
it has a very good tutorial.
Cons:
Camera controls are kind of funky
When you build more advance designs you will have trouble with parts being in the way.

"I rate 8/10 it's worth it in my opinion"- me

author: {'steamid': '76561198224993228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 36788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8701, 'last_played': 1676942287}
review: Dream Car Racing 3D is a fun game were you can use your imagination to build all kinds of cars, trucks and even a rockets, if you are thinking about buying this game you wont be sorry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036997844', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1587430928}
review: This game is great! It takes time to get down the building element. my only complaint is figuring out how to build a proper suspension/steering system, though it was a lot of fun to figure out through trial and error. I recomend looking at videos or guides, though it is a lot of fun to figure out yourself. definitely worth the buy, with a lot of workshop items and replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027865591', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 8483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2685, 'last_played': 1558757720}
review:
Well, this is a really customizable game...... you can create anything from bars and pieces...... I loved it, really.
PROS: Well,..... realease your imagination hahahaha

CONS: It's a bit hard to understand how to build something, but once you learn, you will build many kinds of thing (yes, this game is not only about cars ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198023864385', 'num_games_owned': 5480, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 3612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1083, 'last_played': 1613876649}
review: This is a great physics build it yourself game! At first I thought the frame was too flimsy in game but after thinking about it I was definitely missing links (connections). It has a great concept and lots of room for growth in which the devoper has been very great at reaching out and listening to the community from what I see.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163586005', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 63284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2546, 'last_played': 1707996784}
review: Great game for what it already is! I can see a ton of potential in it. Sometimes a little complicated, but it's all about learning the physics (fun!) and structures of vehicles! I'd definitely recommend this if you like to build cars/planes and what's yet to come!

author: {'steamid': '76561198280587255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1895, 'last_played': 1523080622}
review: best physics game around

author: {'steamid': '76561198284886556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 17922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2231, 'last_played': 1707176520}
review: Dream car racing is a fun game much better then the old ones. Im not to good at the yet but ive seen what you can make in it and there are some awsome thing to be made. The game is a bit add at the start you'll get use to it, I like the game and it's a lot of fun

author: {'steamid': '76561197970435864', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1556309021}
review: If you enjoyed building complex contraptions in garrysmod and testing them on community maps, but found it limiting or frustrating sometimes, then this is the game for you. Well worth supporting, and fun to learn with comprehensive tutorials and online videos to get you started. A perfect 9/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198111918740', 'num_games_owned': 754, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1711224558}
review: Chinese plz

author: {'steamid': '76561198029251216', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 9829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2524, 'last_played': 1580926277}
review: If you love letting you imagination flow and seeing your creations put to work then this game is for you! Not only does this game allow you to build what ever you want like cars, trucks, tanks, and even planes, but it kinda gives you a challenge to make them work just right as well as there is a highly realistic physics system in the game, which I see as fun, others might not. I've always dreamed about desining my own cars, but now I can in this game! I myself probably have spent more time building and designing cars than actually driving them, because its really entertain to see something you've created slowly come to life!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003480586', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1493794450}
review: Amazing game! And even for an early acess game!  Devs r quick to reapond to questions and are always updating and improving the game. A MUST HAVE for anyone that like building/constructing games. Looks confusing and overwheling at 1st but takes no time to see whateverything does and become simple to build.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070913868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1698275450}
review:
It is a very fun building game if you are a car fan or just like messing with physics just a bit.
Game play is simple but it is more than enough to keep you entertained.
If you get it READ THE TOUTORALS they help out a lot. (I like figuring out things by trial and error myself but doing that took me 1/2 hour to get something that rolled arround:D)
There is a LOT that you can customize on it wheels and body as shown in the video and this game has not crashed yet so very well made for early acces.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027378697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1583, 'last_played': 1601694642}
review:
If you like physics games, this is a very good physics game! The physics engine has a very realistic feel and it is smooth as well. 

If you're like me and you like cars, engines and mechanical engineering concepts, you'll probably enjoy this game as much as I have been. I tend to spend hours on one vehicle, tweaking suspension, frame size/weight/length/width, tires until it is just right. This game makes that kind of gameplay available. 

Where this game really shines for me is the suspension. I can't believe how amazing it looks and feels while going over bumps and taking sharp turns. The possibilities of suspensions you can make seem endless, and you're not even limited to just the shocks that are a provided part. You can even use frame parts with elasticity tweaks and come up with your own suspension designs, as you may see when checking out the workshop (which has many, awesome designs).

I personally don't like shallow and arcade-style physics games that invovles vehicles. This one is the opposite. 

Now for some reality: It is early access. The game does feel a little empty after a while. 
A big one for many - it is not multiplayer. Not a big deal for me really but I know some may not prefer that.

But, jets were just added! So one good thing about this game is that it is not done with additional content. So with that in mind, this is a good time waster. I'd say it's well worth the time I've put into it. 

Overall I give this game a thumbs up! For the price, it's definitely a good deal and plenty of enjoyment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071519682', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 766, 'last_played': 1711344065}
review:
Hmm well, the game is fun!  Basically a "cheaper" version of Beamng.drive. But one difference you can build your vehicle! Oh yea it also shows that it is a multiplayer game!  
"Single player: Race on procedurally generated tracks.
Sandbox: Compete with other players using your cars." I'm not sure about you but I comprehend that statement as " I can play by myself or I can race with my friends online." However this is not the case, there is no multiplayer "Only leaderboards"
All in all the game is fairly fun! 
However I am not sure I can recomend this game at this price of $14.99 
***I MAY CHANGE THIS REVIEW AS TIMES GO, CURRENTLY I AM DEBATING A REFUND***

author: {'steamid': '76561198006786950', 'num_games_owned': 60, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1488584955}
review:
I initially bought this game for multiplayer.  The multiplayer tag was on the steam front page.  Upon purchasing the game and searching forums I realized there was no multiplayer.  It is more of a leaderboard that you can race the times of other players.

After speaking to developer he has since removed the tag and I thought it would be fair to edit my review.

The game is  a interesting idea letting you create a vehicle with simple pieces and drive around a sandbox to test your creation.  If you like physics games this can be interesting.  Although I played about 16hours total messing around with the builder, I grew tired of the single player aspect.

For me, I would not recommend this game do to the lack of multiplayer. Although this is just my opinion.  If multiplayer is added in a way to have a realtime race even without collision, I would recommend this game.  As it is now I would not.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998576483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 8018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1211, 'last_played': 1671663598}
review:
Enjoying what's here so far. Maybe a little light on actual content 
and in many peoples opinion there needs to be some tweaks 
to power/weight ratios. But a great 3D interpretation of the 
original PC/browser game. I want to score it lower due to the
"early access" style but I, well, I just can't. Love it.

Would like to see more race tracks along the lines of Highlands
and some force feedback wheel support in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981447208', 'num_games_owned': 661, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1558961585}
review:
Very awesome game, remember to reduce the elasticity of your frame parts - it'll save you an awful lot of early game frustration. 

The only thing really I would add to the game is some legitimate controller support, it would be nice if there was a more analog approach to gassing and braking instead of using WASD which makes for 100% gas and 100% brake whenever you touch the controls. A user friendly tutorial wouldn't hurt either, sort of reminds me of starting out in Beseige.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999993890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 4000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3748, 'last_played': 1514384266}
review:
Si te gustan los coches  y los juegos de edicion,este juego te va a gustar.
Un juego sencillo intuitivo y con algo de dificultad a su vez.
-¬øSencillo porque? porque si intentas hacer algo parecido con alg√∫n programa de edici√≥n 3d tipo blender o 3dmark te puedes tirar 1 a√±o si no sabes XD.Aparte de que,solo harias el dise√±o no podrias pobrarlo. si lo haces con el "garrys mod" tardaras medio a√±o. :V
-¬øIntuitivo porque? porque el juego no esta en espa√±ol y mi nivel de ingles es bajo/nulo.¬øte vale? XD.Ademas vienen tutoriales con imagenes,que pr√°cticamente no hace falta traducirlo.
-¬øDificil porque? porque cada pieza tienes que calibrarla muy bien con los par√°metros que trae,si no,tendras un amasijo de hierros.

El juego solo dispone de 1 mapa (es gigantesco),en el que tendremos que ir recogiendo monedas con nuestro coche para despues ir evolucionando las piezas,o tambien cuenta con un sistema de carreras contra la I.A. en el que genera circuitos aleatorios en ese mapa.
Ademas se pueden descargar coches y mapas que va creando la comunidad(todo gratis), y asi ya no tienes escusa para recoger las monedas XD. 

Las 2 unicas pegas que le veo al juego son:
-No tiene musica,solo sonidos de los efectos.(podrian aver buscado alguna musica sin copiright.....)
-Precio 14.99 Alto. (pero si tienes en cuenta que el juego esta en fase de desarrollo,yo lo veo m√°s una donaci√≥n) o te lo pillas de oferta. Precio merecido si fuese el producto final.9.99 pero repito esta en fase de desarrollo XD. lo compraria igual aunque fuese el producto final  :V

author: {'steamid': '76561198046169725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1361, 'last_played': 1487157482}
review:
In short, I think this game is a great idea. I quite enjoy it, it's fun making your own creation from whatever your imagination can think of and then get to use your idea or publish it for others to enjoy! I haven't been on lately to check out the latest updates but so far I think if there were some way to add support for gamepads or in my case a force feedback wheel and some close racing or even destruction derby/ last vehicle standing wins would make it more awesome. The game could also benefit from greater detail on parts like gearboxes, dedicated steering systems and wheel hubs etc which I believe are in development for the future. 

Cheers RoKo0 for all your hard work on this game!

Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064183101', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1247, 'last_played': 1499973689}

author: {'steamid': '76561197973141625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1514835750}
review:
Amazingly fun game, difficult to figure out, but amazing once you do. Building cars in real life is one of my favorite past-times, so having some place where it doesn't cost me money to try out ideas is a great thing!

If you have no creative imagination, this may not be the game for you, but if you love to tinker, then buy it right away!  I have only successfully built one solid vehicle so far, but getting into designing something to find out if it works is a lot of fun. 

Put the frame together, attach some wheels, an engine, shocks, and steering rod, and watch as it crumbles to pieces because you didn't brace it properly. Laugh about it, go back to the garage and figure out where you went wrong. If you build something worthy, set up a race, and challenge others to drive your custom car through waypoints to see if they can drive it better than you can! 

Overall, the game is still actively changing, but the developer is one that truly cares about the game, going so far as to talk to me personally, and ask me what I think. Never had this experience with any game before, so I can honestly say that I am excited to see what this game becomes!

author: {'steamid': '76561198202491964', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1651, 'last_played': 1671230173}
review:
This game is great. It's still got quite a way to go but it's good as is already.

The GUI is something to get used to at first if you've never done something like 3D modeling before, but it's easy to learn.

It's nice to be able to share and publish cars, be it on the workshop or in-game. You can find some amazing designs if you know where to look.

The most fun part of the game IMO is figuring out what will and will not make your car better, and how to optimize your car for different types of terrain. 

 I've always loved DCR evo and the fact that it's in 3D makes it all the more fun, and more challenging too. Because it's 3D  now there's so many more possibilities, i was actually running out of potential designs in Evo so this was great. 

My only tip is the price. 15 bucks is hefty for what you're getting, if it were a bit more polished(which it is becoming) i'd be okay with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984275550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 7973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3038, 'last_played': 1578162828}
review:
This is really the kind of game that can be enjoyed by players who love to create and share their creations, play with realistic physics and enjoy driving vehicles.

PROS :

- The editor is practical. Using the 3 different views you can easily and precisely place a point wherever you want. A grid allows you to create well aligned stuff. It may look scary at first, but it's far, far, FAR simpler to use than a 3D modeling program. Within a few hours you will have understood all the basics required to make a complete car, chassis and bodywork, without having to read any kind of tutorial.

- The games seems to be very optimized. You can add hundreds or parts to a car without ever noticing a framerate drop. It seems for example to be a lot optimized than other games such as Scrap Mechanic. As of today I have been able to create whatever I wanted to create without even thinking about performance.

- The physics are realistic. Each part can strech, compress, vibrate, etc.

- The (only) developper of the game seems to be very active and seems to care about the feedbacks of player, which is a very encouraging point.

- The price. I paid this game about 11‚Ç¨. I think it's a fair price for this game in its current state.

CONS :

- The game has currently  very little content. You can do races along a track vs little ghost cars. You can drive around, trying to reach a checkpoint after another. You can roam freely to test your creation. And it seems like you can also play online multiplayer, without collisions between players, but I've no tested that yet. This is not surprising considering that this game is only a few monthes old. You wouldn't expect such a recent game to have a lot of content, especially since there is only one developper working on it.

- There is not a lot of information about how to use the game. There is an in-game help which provides informations about the parts and their physical properties. However I think it would have been nice to have a little wiki and a few more tutorial videos for beginners. For instance, I took me a while to search information about what the "angle lock" part was used for. All the tutorial videos I could find were created before the update that introduced this part, so I couldn't find more information about it.

- The developper working on this seems to be almost alone. While he seems to be very active, I'm not sure whether we can expect frequent updates or not, and how much content will come with each update.

- The graphics are really outdated. I know that it's not what people would come for when buying this game, but since it's about being realistic, graphics matter too. Currently there are no asphalt marks, the wheels sometimes seem to sink a bit into the ground because the hitbox of the wheels get deformed based on tire pressure while the 3D model remains solid, there are no beautiful shadows or god rays, and since the maps can be procedurally and randomly generated, there are not many details. I think some official race tracks where players could compete would have been great.

CONLUSION :

I think it's a game worthy of its price which provides you with a freedom that you will never find in any other game that currently exist. There are concurrents like Scrap Mechanic or even Garry's mod, but none of them have the good performances and the freedom of building provided by Dream Car Racing 3D.
Just like with any other early access game, the game has very little content, but it already allows you to create fully functionnal creations without any performance issue and that can be shared on the workshop, which is a very good start. The developpers seems to be planning to add more parts like wings, which suggest that we will be able to create other things than wheeled vehicles in the future.
So in the end, if you like creating and inventing stuff, showing other people what you're capable of and enjoy realistic physics, if you have time and patience, if you care about creating quality stuff, then go for this game. You will probably like it, and even if you don't, well that's not even the price of a meal at McDonalds...

author: {'steamid': '76561197990757214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1571224311}
review:
If you're passoned about cars and how they're made and would like to play around that, this game is for you.

The build section actually feels more like simulation; finding the right geometry to make the chassis act like you want it to, finetuning the strenght of the parts to optimize the weight without compromising the structural integrity...the physics have all of the latest soft body simulation you could expect from a modern video game. Reminds me of BeamNG, but with a much appreciated DIY editor built in.
Wether you want to make a basic road car, a monster truck or a formula one inspired geoetries, you will find all the elements you need to put your ideas into a driveable car!

Racing then becomes so much more gratifying when you're the author of your vehicule; The single player mode has an awesome progression feature that lets you upgrade the different elements as you win longer and harder races, while the sandbox mode and online challenges adds a nice competitive side to it.

The game itself is already in a very advanced state for being early access; it runs perfectly fine here with very little exception, yet the author keeps on adding features regardless, remaining open to suggestions from the users, which is very involving.

If you like the idea of playing in a community with an accent on creativity and sharing ideas, I highly recommend you this game.

Hoping to see you around on the scoreboard and the workshop ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198286017559', 'num_games_owned': 2641, 'num_reviews': 416, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1486306911}

review: An engaging and challenging game that offers a realistic car building experience. The game‚Äôs physics are impressive, and the joy of designing and racing your own car is unparalleled. However, the complexity of the game can be overwhelming for beginners, and it requires a fair amount of time and effort to master. Despite this, the game is rewarding once you get the hang of it, but it lacks a bit of charm and personality, which can make it feel less fun over time.

review:
C‚Äôest trop facile de se moquer d‚Äôun jeu moche. Non, vraiment. Surtout quand il encha√Æne les clich√©s du jeu moche. Dream Car Racing 3D est r√©ellement hideux avec ses quelques textures, sa skybox honteuse et toutes ses mod√©lisations qu‚Äôon n‚Äôose m√™me pas afficher. N√©anmoins, un rictus et deux facepalm plus tard, on se rend compte que Dream Car Racing 3D est un Early Access finalement prometteur.

Non pas que le jeu devienne bon, magnifique, profond‚Ä¶ Mais il se r√©v√®le assez passionnant pour les designers en herbe. En effet, dans le garage du jeu, il est possible de concevoir enti√®rement sa voiture. Au fil de courses g√©n√©r√©es al√©atoirement dans une carte vide (d‚Äôautres, tout aussi vides, sont disponibles sur le Steam Workshop gratuitement), vous gagnerez des pi√®ces vous permettant d‚Äôam√©liorer vos morceaux de t√¥les. Tout cela pour faire de votre voiture la plus puissante, en un mot la meilleure.

Alors non, Dream Car Racing 3D ne sera jamais un bon jeu. Mais voir un projet si humble d√©barquer en Early Access, voir des gens y contribuer en cr√©ant et partageant sur le Workshop, juste parce qu‚Äôune seule id√©e est parvenue √† le sortir du lot‚Ä¶ √ßa force le respect malgr√© tout.

Et si c‚Äô√©tait √ßa, le but d‚Äôun Early Access ? Permettre √† un cr√©ateur de trouver un public pour l‚Äôam√©liorer. Un public conscient que le projet sera jamais merveilleux. Mais au final, si tout le monde y trouve son compte ? ** petits oiseaux qui chantent, optimisme, tout √ßa **

author: {'steamid': '76561198203342489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1574, 'last_played': 1657431090}
review: This game is an amazing improvement over previous dream car iterations with the 3D adding a new dimension of challenge to the builders. I got this game as soon as I could and love experimenting with the various building materials available to me. The game provides a number of ways for you to play it and the workshop is just as healthy and full of creative people as in other iterations of the game! My only real complaint for this game is that figuring out the steering system is a little bit complicated and involves a lot of trial and error, that being said, I still highly recommend this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198066239076', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 16768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3088, 'last_played': 1656624766}
review: By far a very good game for anyone interested in creating cars and the like. Building is simple but can be as complex as you like, and vehicles behave exactly how they should. Your creativity is your only restrictions and with an active player base and dev, theres always new stuff to check out. If you like building cars and dont mind learning some extensive controls, this would be a wonderfull game to pick up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107593629', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 17607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10627, 'last_played': 1703000103}
review:
This is a Sandbox car building game where you literally control every aspect of the car. That being said it is not easy, and if you're not up for a challenge of building a car, there is an option to download other players' cars off of Steam's Workshop. Personally I enjoy spending hour at a time making a car perfect at what it does, and if you enjoy a physics puzzle in a car like me, this is definitely what you've been waiting for, I know it's what I've always wanted, thank you RoKo0.

-Update: A bunch of things have been added, but probably the biggest are; Angle Lock, Jet Engines, and Aerodynamics. With these new updates you can build planes, jet dragsters, and much more sturdy vehicles. One of the most entertaining things about the Aerodynamics is the ability to build incredibly fast racecars. Before you had no downforce, no matter what, but now you can add downforce, to help corners, air resistance, for an air brake, and so much more. The puzzle I speak of has been given more pieces, and am loving every update for the game. Once again, thank you Roko0.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982284657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1863, 'last_played': 1658497600}
review:
This is all as of January 1, 2017 This could all change at the very next update!

I wasn't sure what to expect from this game. The further I dive in I find you truly can create any 'at the time of writing' ground based vehicles. For me I have chosen a design inspired from Elio Motors because to my surprise no one on the workshop had even tried! So this tells me there is room for creative designs from all works of peoples. 


I highly recommend this but remember this is very early and things take time.

Cons:
This game is physics based so things can get wonky as one would espect "Go Easy on the Dev!"

-Parts are sometimes hard to select in the editor
-Wheels can sometimes clip into the ground causing oddities.
-There is officially one main level (There are modded ones.)

Pros: 
-You can literally build any ground based that comes to mind.
-You can mod maps and potentially parts as well.
-It has a very fun upgrade system to make your parts stronger,faster,more weight,etc..
-Each part in itself is scalable and can be painted to look very nice!

I'm excited to see where this game goes in the year ahead of us! Great Job Dev!

author: {'steamid': '76561198333114048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 85891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48931, 'last_played': 1491599935}

author: {'steamid': '76561198152834376', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 8210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3237, 'last_played': 1603770467}
review:
This a great game, although I know some things that could only make it greater. Now, if you were going for a simple, realistic car building/ testing game, then you've done well.

But here is a list of 5 things that would only make the game better.

1) Water
Make the abilty for there to be randomly generated water on the default maps. This could be seen as oceans, lakes, streames, ponds, or even rivers(be even cooler if the water flowed, and moved your car). You would also want there to be the point where if you get water into your intake (more on that in a second) then your car would die. Lastly, you would want to make optional, for the people whose computers may have trouble running too much.

2) Intake
Another idea is intakes. They are quite simple. They bring in the air for the engine. One thing you could also do, is make it  so that, depending where they are placed, they can get better air flow.

3) Exaust
You could tune it, make it louder, or just cut it off. This would really just be for fun.

4) Defomable Ground
You could add some sort of vairable texture, or something, where as the ground could move out from under you. You could also add mud with the water update (if you made that a thing). It would be cool to have something where you were driving through mud, then you spun out, and gou stuck. you could also add diffrent ground textures to go with this. You could work on the sand, add gravel , mud, and other stuff too, like tall grass.

5) Winch
The last thing that I would like to include is a winch. I wouldn't care about this one as much the other things, but some other people might.

That just about wraps it up. Although lastly I would like to add that you could also add trees, and bushes, and other stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996077235', 'num_games_owned': 506, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1362, 'last_played': 1556908329}
review:
Very good game, and the developer is constantly working on it (unlike, it seems, many other early-access games). It's great for anyone who's been into those bridge building games, or physics based games, or even just racing/off road car games.

Pros:
- Virtually bug free, which is fantastic for early-access.
- Excellent physics modelling; everything behaves how you should expect it to, and behaves accurately.
- Best integration with the Steam Workshop that I've seen in-game. Already a lot of user-made creations.
- Custom maps available, though the standard map has a lot of different terrain to get you going.
- Level of "OCD" is up to you; you can build a car pretty quick (or customize a default or steam Workshop car) and get racing, or spend hours tweaking every little aspect and getting things just right to shave a second or two off your laps.
- Very familiar GUI/controls to anybody who has used a CAD program before. 3-window modelling space is a great idea and works very well to let you see what you're doing.

Cons:
- Graphics could be better. Based on my framerates, this game could increase its textures and add some better shaders without being a hinderance to even mid-level PCs.
- GUI needs an update; the menus and buttons look a bit like an old Windows 95 strategy game or something.
- No controller support (YET. This is on the Dev's ToDo list, so check the details and discussions to see if it's been implemented when you read this if controller support is a must-have). Having said that, due to the nature of the off-road racing, the keyboard isn't nearly as annoying to use as a road racing game for the time being.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155146718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1598044355}
review: I had the original 2d Dream Car Racing. It was a concept that I thought was perfect for those of us who like to build and test things. That has been magically transformed into 3d and now we can all truly create our dream car. I have seen realistic looking vehicles in the workshop. I have also seen fantasy and scifi looking vehicles. If You enjoy creating vehicles to drive around for nothing more than fun, this might be for You.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994174626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 64809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28664, 'last_played': 1643176772}
review:
This game, for me, has taken more hours than any other game (except perhaps Skyrim with mods) and I still enjoy it.  It is early on and plans exist to expand it and include a lot more, but I am already having a blast making everything from as realistic a vehicle as it gets to utter wacko creations (walker isn't supported yet, but I've made a few, a 'grasshopper' as well and too many wheels for my sanity one too).

Great fun if you like constructing vehicle and try out ideas and find solutions to 'why does this happen' and then realise the solution - if you experiment like me, any way.  Can also go the route I have not - make cars to race with.  I prefer exploring concepts myself.

I hope to one day see the return of an actual, functional power transmission from engine to wheel (and eventually track etc), I do miss that and am no fan of magic power transfer without connection - but that is my only 'gripe' with the game, and I still sink too many hours into it still.  ^_^

author: {'steamid': '76561198110800641', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1560044416}
review:
Dream Car Racing 3D ist eine gelungene Kombi aus Autobaukasten und -simulator.
Es gibt aktuell noch drei gr√∂√üere Wehmutstropfen:
-Fehlende Controllerunterst√ºtzung (Fahren und Lenken nur mit Tastatur m√∂glich)
-Ausschlie√ülich Maps f√ºr Offroadfahrten verf√ºgbar
-Deutsche Sprache wird nicht unterst√ºtzt
Ich kann mir aber gut vorstellen, dass diese drei Nachteile irgendwann noch ausgemerzt werden.
F√ºr Fans von Rennspielen und Fahrzeugsimulationen, die ein wenig Englisch oder Russisch k√∂nnen, ist dieses Spiel aber auch jetzt schon sehr empfehlenswert, unter anderem in Hinblick auf die gro√üe Menge an Fahrzeugen, die bereits im Steam Workshop verf√ºgbar ist.
Auf meinem YouTube-Kanal findet ihr eine Playliste mit Let's Plays, falls ihr vor einem potenziellen Kauf erst noch einen detaillierteren Eindruck des Spiels bekommen wollt: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLSLOx_Txo3YiMHYgwykeunu_gwwYEYjL2

author: {'steamid': '76561198017593079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1533384075}
review:
I have been a fan of dream car racing evo for about a year, and was very excited to try out this 3D version! While building has become a LOT more complex in 3 dimensions compared to the 2D blueprint of previous games, it is certainly a lot more realistic, with the ability to truly experiment with different configurations and suspensions. A tough learning curve prevents me from fully enjoying the game so far, but I would definitely recommend it to those of you who know a bit about engineering (or would like to learn).

I hope the creator releases a few tutorials for people like me who need a little guidance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991993273', 'num_games_owned': 1498, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 22957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2290, 'last_played': 1674277241}
review:
Saw this game in a video. Immediately looked it up, bought it, played. I've had it for less than a week at the time of this review, and I've sunk nearly 30 hours into it already.

TL;DR:If you like building games, this is an excellent choice.

For the marginally longer version:

The basics of the game involve constructing a wire frame out of beams with ball joints. This means making triangular structures and chaining them together to get a sturdy chassis.

Attach some wheels, an engine, some shocks and steering rods and BOOM! you have a car.

Now make it better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009916106', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1549237455}
review:
I got the steam key from developers so that i can check out the game, well I must say, this game has potential, but in current state it's not that great.

Graphics are very, very basic, sound effects are almost non existing, but I do hope they improve the game.

I absolutely love the concept of this game, I like how you can freely design your car with in-game simplified model editor with almost no limits, you can put more than 1 engine, have like 100 wheels and stuff.
Game also has steam workshop which makes it really good, so people can share their creations and also edit them.

However what really made me press that YES button under "recommend" is that the game has soft body physics!
Vehicles deform just like in BeamNG.
It's too early to say anything else about the game, I didn't experience any of the usual bs that you get in other early access games, such as crashes, lag ..etc. Game runs smooth (over 200fps in 4k) and did not crash or glitch.

What i'd like to see in the game:
- better graphics + ability to add textures to your vehicles
- pre-made objects that you can attach to cars (lights, mirrors, pedals, steering wheels ..etc)
- realistic sounds (glass breaking, metal grinding, tyres screetching, tyres blowing up ..etc)
- controller support! can't drive with keyboard ... it's pain

I think with those additions, this game can really shine :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198149316566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1031, 'last_played': 1509986665}
review:
I‚Äôve played many hours of Sandbox early access building games running on the unity physics engine so naturally I was attracted to the game when I came across it on Youtube. I must admit I bought the game on impulse without knowing too much about it but I thought the price was very reasonable so I took a chance although I‚Äôve been disappointed many times in the past.

I can now confidently say that the game has exceeded my expectations and is more than worth the price tag. If you are expecting another Besiege, Scrap Mechanic or Robocraft you are in the wrong place. The game will not hold your hand, this is not a Lego style ‚Äústick a bunch of blocks together and attach wheels‚Äù type of game. At first you will be frustrated after spending 3 hours building a car only to see it collapse under its own weight. You will go back to the drawing board, re-design the frame, re-tweak, test and repeat until finally you have a solid frame with awesome suspension and steering and you get that sense of satisfaction and accomplishment.

As far as Sandbox games go, this is proper Sandbox as you are not limited by blocks and you don‚Äôt have to stick to square angles. With only a handful of building parts you can make complex vehicles in any shape or size. 

What other content is in the game? The integration into the Steam workshop gives you endless things to play with as new maps are uploaded. Make your own racing tracks or just fool around with other people‚Äôs creations. There is Single player and multiplayer that I haven‚Äôt even tried yet (Not sure if Multiplayer is out yet). In a nutshell you won‚Äôt get bored as there is plenty to.

I was very impressed when I had questions or needed help in the Steam Community Discussions that the developer actually takes time to respond to you and assist where he can. The community also seems very helpful over all. The game is off to a great start for an early access and I haven‚Äôt found any major bugs. I am very excited to see where the developer can take this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198322602498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 61230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1135, 'playtime_at_review': 1464, 'last_played': 1712425145}
review:
I was looking for long for this kind of game. And finally I found it.

This game is beta but even now is great and fun to play. You can build there any car you want with any engine you want and any suspension you want, there is only one barrier your imagination.

In game tools are easy to understand, phisics are great, and even if you want you can buld a deformable vehicle. And of course you can share your design in Steam Workshop or build in game Workshop, easy as can be.

There is only one map but hey this game is avaliable for few days and we have 3 addon maps. I am looking forward for more addon maps.

Great appreciation to developer!

Would buy again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068903810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1476735533}
review:
This game has great potential, the controls already feel well polished and the game has much room for growth;

I see a great community-driven game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035669409', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 11424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 140, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1711931968}
review:
Very fun game! More complicated than the original 2D flash games, but after a couple minutes, it's not too hard to figure out. Highly recommended if you're a fan of sandbox games, racing games, or cars/mechanics.
EDIT:
Recent updates have added lift for panels and jet engines. I can't stop playing, making airplanes, flying go-carts, etc. This update made the game at least twice as fun, and for anyone who has learned how to design planes from games such as Kerbal Space Program or Simple Planes, I would challenge you to try in this game. It's more difficult (you have to manually design the control surfaces) but about 10x more rewarding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170945422', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 10009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5196, 'last_played': 1673768483}
review:
1) Yes I've noticed bugs but I've already reported them to you and the ones I have seen have been fixed already
2) Most things are clear in the game but I would recommend adding video support in-game so you can post tutorials on how to make something like a working suspension, instead of prebuilt saves you can load.
3) I love this game and have not gotten bored of it mostly because I am usually in sandbox, although I still enjoy single player.
4) I like single player but I think it needs work and some refinement, for example you need to add some racing maps in, add tracks, and when you can publish the best map or track someone has made into single player.
5) My opinion about sandbox is that it is amazing and that I love how you can post tracks in-game for other people to try out and it's fun to be able to build what ever you want and just mess around and enjoy it.
6) My opinion of the game is 4 out of 5 stars because of how great of a game this is and how you can build what ever you want and their is almost no limit to what you can build. The reason I didn't give this game a higher rating is because it still needs work and it still has those few ideas and details that would make this game ever better, I enjoyed this game and can't wait to see what becomes of it in the future

This game has been fixed 5 out of 5 stars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094617136', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 21966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10453, 'last_played': 1528917775}
review:
Any bugs?:

I have noticed a plethora of bugs, all of which were resolved within 24 hours (Except a recent one which the developer is working on/has fixed in this last update)

How were the directions:

 Well, I practically re-wrote the directions/help (And had fun doing so, I love writing and tweaking my work and developing my communications skills) so if anything is confusing it is on me. Obviously I confidently support my work as good, but still, I am human. Error is inevitable.

How much did I earn in single player before you got tired: 

I do not know, still not tired of this game. I've loged 170 hours by the time of this post

Singleplayer: 

Needs tweaking, but is very good as it stands.


Multiplayer:

 I like it, but I feel it should be tied in some way to single player in some way to motivate/force the player to gain experience in single player force. You do not want someone to see incredible records, try in vain to beat them, then rage quit and leave a bad review. (Very much my opinion)


My position as a beta tester:

For one to think that I am merely just another beta tester would simply be uninformed. I have distinctly left my mark on this game. That being said, I am just that, a beta tester. A beta tester lucky enough to get included in a project where he could make a difference. I have beta tested many games, but never have I enjoyed it as much as I have enjoyed beta testing this game. I do not understand why he chose my email over anyone else's, but in the end (Speaking from that it is two days before release) I took the opportunity and ran with it.


My opinion on the development of DCR 3D:

I feel this game has the potential to be the next big thing. Roman (RoKo0) is an absolute genius (Coming from someone with a 140 IQ, I'm no genius, but I can recognize one), I can distinctly see where he made decisions in developing his IP (Intellectual property) that many would have mistakenly overlooked. For example, his decision to make 2D variations of his IP before making a 3D one. Doing this bagged him a following before he even started work on the 3D version. He stuck to his guns through the beta testing period, where I frequently pushed him to make the game more realistic. In the end, I feel he found the perfect balance between realism and the softer cartoon-ish side of the game that makes it so charming (Something that I milked with my recent map and car designs).


How I started playing DCR:

I first saw DCR on Flonga many years ago. I tried everything I knew to crack the game. Even downloading the flash version of the game and running it in an isolated environment and searching for changing variables with cheat engine (I.E, I would search all variables with cheat engine, then earn money search for changed variables, not earn money, search for unchanged variables etc...). The simple fact that I could not crack his game, hooked me and I soon bought the first iteration of his game (Admittedly, if it was more expensive, I would have tried harder and eventually at least hacked credits).


My opinion of DCR 3D:

Right now it is really fun (10/10, I mean it has kept me till the 240th Beta Test post, which is my 88th, and 170 in-game hours so far), but looking at his plans for the future, it is going to be so much better. I look forward to watching this game spread its wings, but I am not convinced that this game is completely ready to leave its chrysalis. That being said, I recognize that the game needs to be released sometime and that there is no better time than when you have everything working perfectly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000662213', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1510616660}
review: (Reviewing experience of the pre-release beta) I recorded a first look/highlights video of this for my channel a few days before release and it made for some fun and entertaining footage!  This is a game with serious potential in building capabilities.  It is very complex, looking at all the options going into it, but the complexity is clearly a testament to the amount of creative freedom the game allows you to have.  There is a ton of room for improvement of course, but It looks like those improvements are being worked on regularly.  I hope the development of this game continues into what I know it can be!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020125851', 'num_games_owned': 15680, 'num_reviews': 840, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1486263014}
review:
[h1]A Car Building Sandbox Racing Game[/h1]
https://youtu.be/OhLvcG6eeCM
+ The car editor is very easy to understand and use without any instruction.
+ Lots of options to modify, for example: Wheel size, pressure, suspension, torque, transmission, etc., building a reliable car is actually pretty challenging.
+ You can test out other user's creations, and modify them however you like which is a ton of fun!
+ The map itself is HUGE giving you plenty of space
+ Very easy to publish your car to the server / steam workshop without any hassle. It's also very simple to load up other creations, and takes no time at all.

[b]This game is in Early Access so these are subject to change[/b]
- The engine sounds for every car need to be improved.
- No background music
- The physics are a bit odd. Every car is overly bouncy and need a bit more weight
- The map itself is just a series of hills and mountains. Good for off-roading, but I feel like it would be great if the developer could add some flatlands or actual road racetracks.
- The "races" are a bit unfair as the AI little cars don't have to deal with physics
